definition: to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)

sentences.english: A savage howl, like an ominous setting sun, punctured immortality so slimy and solemn.
sentences.chinese: 有狂野的嗥叫像不祥的残阳击穿粘稠肃穆的永恒。

sentences.english: With a leap and a howl, he came down on his back and held on tight.
sentences.chinese: 随着一声嗥叫，他跳到了雪人的背上，紧紧抓住了它。

sentences.english: The coyotes howl with the same wish.
sentences.chinese: 山狗嗥叫，有著同样的愿望。

sentences.english: She turned around after hearing an animal's growl.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽听见她背后有一只动物在嗥叫，于是转过身来。

sentences.english: A sudden howl pierced the silence.
sentences.chinese: 突然一声嗥叫划破了寂静。

sentences.english: I haven't heard wolves howling for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 我已经有好长时间听不到狼的嗥叫了。

sentences.english: But we can't, you know, howl together.
sentences.chinese: 但我不能，你知道，一起嗥叫。

sentences.english: Jackals cry in chorus from the courtyard of the deserted house in the light of the worn-out moon.
sentences.chinese: 疲惫的月光中，豺狼在被废弃的院落中齐声嗥叫。

sentences.english: The wolf was beaten by the farmer. He ran howling away.
sentences.chinese: 农夫把狼痛打一顿，狼便嗥叫地落荒而逃。

sentences.english: Wolves are howling in the distance.
Our dog always growls at visitors.
sentences.chinese: 我们的狗老是对着客人嗥叫。

sentences.english: The wild boar had its tusk sunk deeply into a tree and howled desperately.
sentences.chinese: 野猪的獠牙陷在了树里，绝望地嗥叫着。

definition: to whinny (of a horse)/to neigh/to shout
to roar (of animals)/to wail/to cry out in distress/see also 呼號|呼号[hu1 hao2]
(of animals, the wind etc) to make a mournful sound/whine/moan/wail
to cry piteously/anguished wailing/same as 哀嚎
yelling (sound made by person)/barking/braying/roaring (sound made by animals)
